member.name: P:Catel.Data.IValidationContext.LastModifiedTicks
member.summary:
Gets the last modified ticks which is much more precise that the . Use this value to compare last modification ticks on other validation contexts.
Because only full .NET provides a stopwatch, this property is only available in full .NET. All other target frameworks will return the which is not reliable.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.IValidationSummary.LastModifiedTicks
member.summary:
Gets the last modified ticks which is much more precise that the . Use this value to compare last modification ticks on other validation contexts.
Because only full .NET provides a stopwatch, this property is only available in full .NET. All other target frameworks will return the which is not reliable.

member.name: M:Catel.Data.ModelBase.InitializeCustomProperties
member.summary:
Allows the initialization of custom properties. This is a virtual method that is called inside the constructor before the object is fully constructed.
This might be considered as bad or as a hack, but it's a good way to be able to inject custom properties before any actual logic is handled by derived classes.
member.remarks: Only use when you really know what you are doing.

member.name: M:Catel.Data.ModelBase.SetValueFast(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Sets the value fast without checking for any constraints or additional logic such as change notifications. This means that if this method is used incorrectly, it can throw random exceptions.
This is a wrapper around the _propertyValues field. Don't use the field directly, always use this method because it takes care of locking and event subscriptions.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.ModelBase.HideValidationResults
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the validation results should be hidden. This means that the should be filled, but the and should not expose any of the validation ressults.
This is very useful when the validation in the UI should be delayed to a specific point. However, the validation is still available for retrieval.
By default, this value is false.

member.remarks: Unlike the property, this property will not prevent validation. It will only prevent the error interfaces to not expose them.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.ValidationContext.LastModified
member.summary:
Gets the last modified date/time.
Note that this is just an informational value and should not be used for comparisons. The is not accurate enough. Use the LastModifiedTicks instead.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.ValidationContext.LastModifiedTicks
member.summary:
Gets the last modified ticks which is much more precise that the . Use this value to compare last modification ticks on other validation contexts.
Because only full .NET provides a stopwatch, this property is only available in full .NET. All other target frameworks will return the which is not reliable.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.ValidationSummary.LastModified
member.summary:
Gets the last modified date/time.
Note that this is just an informational value and should not be used for comparisons. The is not accurate enough. Use the LastModifiedTicks instead.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.ValidationSummary.LastModifiedTicks
member.summary:
Gets the last modified ticks which is much more precise that the . Use this value to compare last modification ticks on other validation contexts.
Because only full .NET provides a stopwatch, this property is only available in full .NET. All other target frameworks will return the which is not reliable.

member.name: T:Catel.DynamicEventListener
member.summary: Dynamic event listener which enables the subscription to events where the type of the handler is unknown. This class uses the ILGenerator to create the dynamic methods.
member.remarks:
Some parts in this class (with the instances and increments), but this is required to dynamically subscribe to an even that we do not know the handler of on forehand. Normally, you would do this via an anynomous delegate, but that doesn't work so the event delegate is created via ILGenerator at runtime.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8122085/calling-an-instance-method-when-event-occurs/8122242#8122242.

member.name: T:Catel.DynamicEventListener.HandlerDictionary
member.summary: A dictionary so the ILGenerator code can access the Get method.
member.remarks: Do NOT remove this type. It is required for dynamic reflection.

member.summary: Gets the with the specified key.

member.summary: The log.

member.name: T:Catel.MustBeImplementedException
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not yet implemented but is supported in the current platform.
Unfortunately, the team has limited resources and must focus on the most requested features. Feel free to create a pull request or notify the team that you are missing this feature.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInPlatformException
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in the current platform.
Unfortunately, some platforms miss a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually the specified platform) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.name: T:Catel.IFluent
member.summary: Interface that is used to build fluent interfaces and hides methods declared by from IntelliSense.
member.remarks:
Code that consumes implementations of this interface should expect one of two things:
When referencing the interface from within the same solution (project reference), you will still see the methods this interface is meant to hide.
When referencing the interface through the compiled output assembly (external reference), the standard Object methods will be hidden as intended.
See http://bit.ly/ifluentinterface for more information.

member.summary: Checks whether the 2 specified objects are equal. This method is better, simple because it also checks boxing so 2 integers with the same values that are boxed are equal.
member.returns: true if the objects are equal; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.ObjectHelper.AreEqualReferences(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Checks whether the 2 specified objects are equal references. This method is better, simple because it also checks boxing so 2 integers with the same values that are boxed are equal.
Two objects are considered equal if one of the following expressions returns true:
Both values are null.
Both values have the same reference, checked by .
Both values are value types and have the same value.
Both values are string type and have the same value.
member.returns: true if the objects are equal references; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.ObjectHelper.IsNull(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is null or DBNull.Value.
member.returns: true if the specified object is null or DBNull.Value; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.IoC.IoCConfigurationSection
member.summary: IoC configuration section.

example.code: <configuration> <configSections> <sectionGroup name="catel"> <section name="ioc" type="Catel.IoC.IoCConfigurationSection, Catel.Core" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections> <catel> <ioc> <serviceLocatorConfigurations> <serviceLocatorConfiguration [name="default"]> <register interfaceType="Catel.Services.IUIVisualizerService" implementationType="Catel.Services.UIVisualizerService" /> <register interfaceType="Catel.Services.IProcessService" implementationType="Catel.Services.ProcessService" /> <!-- Add more registrations here if is requiered --> </serviceLocatorConfiguration> <serviceLocatorConfiguration name="test"> <register interfaceType="Catel.Services.IUIVisualizerService" implementationType="Catel.Services.Test.UIVisualizerService" type="Transient"/> <register interfaceType="Catel.Services.IProcessService" implementationType="Catel.Services.Test.ProcessService" /> <!-- Add more registrations here if is requiered --> </serviceLocatorConfiguration> </serviceLocatorConfigurations> </ioc> </catel> </configuration>

member.name: T:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator
member.summary:
The service locator which is used to retrieve the right instances of services.
The cool thing about this service locator is that it can use external containers (from example from Unity) to resolve types if the types are not registered in the container itself. To do this, use the following code:
var serviceLocator = ServiceLocator.Default; serviceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(myUnityContainer);
The service locator will use the external containers in case the current container does not contain the type. If the external containers also don't contain the type, there is one last way to resolve the type using the event. The event passes that contains the type the service locator is looking for. By setting the or in the handler, the service locator will resolve the type.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the service locator can resolve non abstract types without registration.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service locators will automatically register types via attributes.
member.remarks: By default, this value is true.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.IgnoreRuntimeIncorrectUsageOfRegisterAttribute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service locators will ignore incorrect usage of and do not throw .
member.remarks: By default, this value is true.

member.name: E:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.MissingType
member.summary:
Occurs when a type cannot be resolved the by service locator. It first tries to raise this event.
If there are no handlers or no handler can fill up the missing type, an exception will be thrown by the service locator.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetApplicationDataDirectory
member.summary:
Gets the application data directory for the company and product as defined the the assembly information of the entry assembly. If the entry assembly is null, this method will fall back to the calling assembly to retrieve the information. If the folder does not exist, the folder is automatically created by this method.
This method returns a value like [application data]\[company]\[product name].
member.returns: Directory for the application data.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetApplicationDataDirectory(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the application data directory for a specific product. If the folder does not exist, the folder is automatically created by this method.
This method returns a value like [application data]\[product name].
member.returns: Directory for the application data.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a relative path string from a full path.
The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory The base path to truncate to and replace
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.param: Full path to convert to relative path.
The base path (a.k.a. working directory). If this parameter is null or empty, the current working directory will be used.
member.returns: Relative path.

member.summary: Returns the full path for a relative path.
member.param: Relative path to convert to a full path.
member.returns: Full path.

member.name: M:Catel.Logging.LogExtensions.ErrorAndThrowException``1(Catel.Logging.ILog,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Writes the specified message as error message and then throws the specified exception.
The specified exception must have a constructor that accepts a single string as message.

example.code:
This example logs an error and immediately throws the exception:
Log.ErrorAndThrowException<NotSupportedException>("This action is not supported");

member.exception: The does not have a constructor accepting a string.

member.name: T:Catel.Logging.LogManager
member.summary:
Log manager that allows external libraries to subscribe to logging of Catel.
The manager automatically adds an instance of the to the list of listeners so the tracing is available in debug mode. To remove this listener, call before doing any initialization.

member.name: T:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo
member.summary: Class containing log info.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether any logging is enabled, which means there is at least one listener.
member.value: true if this instance is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IgnoreCatelLogging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Catel logging should be ignored. This means that all log listeners are ignoring Catel logging.
member.value: true if Catel logging is ignored; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsDebugEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether debug logging is enabled. This means that there is at least one listener that is interested in debug logging.
member.value: true if debug logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsInfoEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether info logging is enabled. This means that there is at least one listener that is interested in info logging.
member.value: true if info logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsWarningEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether warning logging is enabled. This means that there is at least one listener that is interested in warning logging.
member.value: true if warning logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsErrorEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether error logging is enabled. This means that there is at least one listener that is interested in error logging.
member.value: true if error logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.UpdateLogInfo
member.summary: Updates the log info.

member.name: M:Catel.Logging.LogManager.LogInfo.IsLogEventEnabled(Catel.Logging.LogEvent)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified log event is enabled.
member.returns: true if the specified log event is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:Catel.Logging.LogManager._logListeners
member.summary: List of all registered instances.

member.name: F:Catel.Logging.LogManager._loggers
member.summary: Dictionary containing the logs per type.

member.name: F:Catel.Logging.LogManager.Log
member.summary: Logging of the class. Must be declared after the log listeners and loggers.

member.name: M:Catel.Logging.LogManager.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the class.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.IgnoreCatelLogging
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the global IgnoreCatelLogging should be overriden.
Note that this value will override all settings of each listener globally. If this value is set to null, nothing will be overriden.
member.value: true if Catel logging must be ignored for all log listeners; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Logging.LogManager.IsDebugEnabled
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the global IsDebugEnabled should be overriden.
Note that this value will override all settings of each listener globally. If this value is set to null, nothing will be overriden.
member.value: true if debug logging must be enabled for all log listeners; otherwise, false.

member.summary:
The interface definition for our Message mediator. This allows loose-event coupling between components in an application by sending messages to registered elements.
This class implements the mediator pattern.

member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for a specific message with the specified tag.

member.summary:
Unregisters a specific recipient for all the (non-static) message the recipient is subscribed to.
This method ignores any tags. If a message recipient matches the specified recipient, it is unsubscribed.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.summary:
Cleans up the list of registered handlers. All handlers that are no longer alive are removed from the list.
This method is automatically invoked after each call to , but can also be invoked manually.

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2
member.summary:
Base class for messages distributed via the Catel MessageMediator subsystem. Inherit from this class to define individual message types.
For most subclasses the only thing to code is an empty class body including the type parameters.
For the payload data you can choose betweeen the following options:
The Data property provided within this base class of type TData using simple types like int or string.
The Data property provided within this base class of type TData using userdefined data types.
Define properties on the derived message class itself.
A combination of the previous options.
member.typeparam: The actual type of the message.
The type of payload data to be carried with the message.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Necessary for two reasons:
Create an instance of the Message class via the TMessage type parameter used by the With() method.
Allow derived classes to be defined using an empty class body with the implicit default constructor.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Provides access to the payload data.

member.summary: Use MessageClass.SendWith(data) to send a new message via the mediator service.
member.param: The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.Send(`0,System.Object)
member.summary: Send the message.
member.param: The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.Register(System.Object,System.Action{`0},System.Object)
member.summary:
Convenient helper method to subscribe to this Message type.
Usage:
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler) if the handler has the signature void Handler(MessageClass message)
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler(msg.Data)) if the handler has the signature void Handler(TData data)
member.param: The instance which registers to the messages. Is most cases this will be this.
A delegate handling the incoming message. For example: msg => Handler(msg.Data).
The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.Unregister(System.Object,System.Action{`0},System.Object)
member.summary:
Convenient helper method to unsubscribe from this Message type.
Usage:
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler) if the handler has the signature void Handler(MessageClass message)
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler(msg.Data)) if the handler has the signature void Handler(TData data)
member.param: The instance which unregisters from the messages. Is most cases this will be this.
A delegate handling the incoming message. For example: msg => Handler(msg.Data).
The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.With(`1)
member.summary:
Returns an instance of the MessageClass populated with payload Data.
Most times used internally by the method.
member.returns: An instance of the MessageClass populated with the given payload data.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.AssemblyHelper.GetAllTypesSafely(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Gets all types from the assembly safely. Sometimes, the is thrown, and no types are returned. In that case the user must manually get the successfully loaded types from the .
This method automatically loads the types. If the occurs, this method will return the types that were loaded successfully.
member.param: If set to true, the loader exceptions will be logged.
member.returns: The array of successfully loaded types.

Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeCache.InitializeTypes(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Initializes the types in Silverlight. It does this by looping through all loaded assemblies and registering the type by type name and assembly name.
The types initialized by this method are used by .
member.param: If true, the types are initialized, even when the types are already initialized.
Name of the assembly. If null, all assemblies will be checked.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeCache.InitializeTypes(System.Boolean,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Initializes the types in the specified assembly. It does this by looping through all loaded assemblies and registering the type by type name and assembly name.
The types initialized by this method are used by .
member.param: If true, the types are initialized, even when the types are already initialized.
The assembly to initialize the types from. If null, all assemblies will be checked.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeCache.InitializeTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes the types in the specified assembly. It does this by looping through all loaded assemblies and registering the type by type name and assembly name.
The types initialized by this method are used by .

If true, the types are initialized, even when the types are already initialized.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializer.Warmup(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Warms up the specified types. If the is null, all types known in the deriving from the class will be initialized.
Note that it is not required to call this, but it can help to prevent an additional performance impact the first time a type is serialized.
member.param: The types to warmp up. If null, all types will be initialized.
The types per thread. If -1, all types will be initialized on the same thread.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.SerializerBase`1.Warmup(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Warms up the specified types. If the is null, all types known in the will be initialized.
Note that it is not required to call this, but it can help to prevent an additional performance impact the first time a type is serialized.
member.param: The types to warmp up. If null, all types will be initialized.
The types per thread. If -1, all types will be initialized on the same thread.

member.summary:
Determines whether the specified type is a special .NET collection type which should be added to the serialization known types.
All generic collections in the System.Collections.Generic namespace are considered special. Besides these classes, the ObservableCollection{T} is also considered special.
member.returns: true if the specified type is a special collection type; otherwise, false.

If no exception is thrown by the method, this method will throw an exception. If the wrong exception is thrown by the delegate, this method will thrown an exception as well.
member.param: The exception validator. If null, the exception will not be validated custom.
member.returns: The exception so it can be further analyzed if required.

member.name: T:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: Provides a syncronization context to acquire or release exclusive lock of an object and execute thread safe code.

member.summary: The sync obj.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether is the lock is acquired.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Execute(System.Action)
member.summary: This method execute the into a exclusive lock.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Execute``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: This method execute the into a exclusive lock and returns a value.
member.returns: The result of execute the code.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released, blocking the current thread.

member.summary: Acquires an exclusive lock.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Release
member.summary: Releases an exclusive lock.
